column4: OK, maybe I should ask a simpler question.  Does anyone know how to set up an internet connection share step-by-step (which is not the way the help page does it with the graphical set-up)?
command line you mean?
no, command-line isn't working.  iptables doesn't work
I mean using the nm-applet
oh... dunno
because it worked a month ago, then Ubuntu borked it
if an update broke something PLEASE file a bug!
like, ASAP, so we can revert it
problem is, I don't know what package it would be
you say network manager could do connection sharing a month ago?
would it be network-manager?
yes
in lucid?
yes
problem is that I can't get both Ethernet cards active at the same time
additional problem is that any connection profile I create is carried over with the main Internet connection to the other card
ok, network-manager package hasnt changed since april
lemme check the nm gnome one
maybe I should check a second connection client other than my Roku?  Only other one I know of is my laptop
hmm thats from the same source package so hasnt changed eiher...
gotta restart network-manager, might be on to something with connecting to my laptop
